headline: Falling Rates Breathe Life Into Regional Banking Stocks. What the Charts Are Saying.
summary: In the chart below, the  confirms the signal of a bullish inverse head and shoulders pattern by breaking $65—a good entry point—setting the stage for a potential rally toward $82 by early 2026.  For context, the fund, which was trading down 0.3% at $65.30 in premarket trading Friday, has climbed 6% over the past month and 16% over the last three, outpacing the broader  which rose 1% and 6% over the same periods.  Topping the fund’s holdings, Citizens Financial Group has surged an impressive 19% this year, while boasting a nice dividend yield of 3.2%.

headline: Citizens Financial Group Announces Earnings Conference Call Schedule for 2027 Quarterly Financial Results
summary: PROVIDENCE, R.I., August 29, 2025--Citizens Financial Group, Inc. (NYSE: CFG) today announced plans to release 2027 quarterly financial results and host live conference calls on the following dates.
